newsitem.title: USA: Wis. finance panel approves $12.1 mln water bonds.
newsitem.headline: Wis. finance panel approves $12.1 mln water bonds.

text.p: Wisconson's joint legislative finance committee has approved $12.13 million of general obligation bonds for the state drinking water loan program.

The finance committee, which includes both senators and representatives, approved the bond issuance last week to take advantage of a matching federal loan program created last year, said Kendra Bonderud, a budget analyst for the legislative fiscal bureau.
The federal government will provide $60.64 million under the current program estimate, Bonderud said.
The committee also approved a $20 million reallocation of clean water funds and wastewater loan repayments, Bonderud said.
The committee recommendations must next be approved by the respective houses of the legislature before they can be passed on to Gov. Tommy Thompson.
